{{cpp/title|cauchy_distribution}}
{{cpp/numeric/random/cauchy_distribution/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=random|since=c++11|1=
template&lt; class RealType = double &gt;
class cauchy_distribution;
}}

Produces random numbers according to a {{enwiki|Cauchy distribution}} (also called Lorentz distribution):

:{{mathjax-or|1=\({\small f(x;a,b)={(b\pi{[1+{(\frac{x-a}{b})}^{2}]} })}^{-1}\)|2=f(x; a,b) = {{mparen|(|)|bÏ€ {{mparen|[|]|1 + {{mparen|(|)|{{mfrac||x - a|b}}}}{{su|p=2}}}}}}{{su|p=-1}}}}

{{tt|std::cauchy_distribution}} satisfies all requirements of {{named req|RandomNumberDistribution}}.

{{example
|code=
#include &lt;algorithm&gt;
#include &lt;cmath&gt;
#include &lt;iomanip&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;map&gt;
#include &lt;random&gt;
#include &lt;vector&gt;

{{cpp/numeric/draw_vbars}}

int main()
{
    std::random_device rd{};
    std::mt19937 gen{rd()};

    auto cauchy = [&amp;gen](const float x0, const float ğ›¾)
    {
        std::cauchy_distribution&lt;float&gt; d{x0 /* a */, ğ›¾ /* b */};

        const int norm = 1'00'00;
        const float cutoff = 0.005f;

        std::map&lt;int, int&gt; hist{};
        for (int n = 0; n != norm; ++n)
            ++hist[std::round(d(gen))];

        std::vector&lt;float&gt; bars;
        std::vector&lt;int&gt; indices;
        for (auto const&amp; [n, p] : hist)
            if (float x = p * (1.0 / norm); cutoff &lt; x)
            {
                bars.push_back(x);
                indices.push_back(n);
            }

        std::cout &lt;&lt; "xâ‚€ = " &lt;&lt; x0 &lt;&lt; ", ğ›¾ = " &lt;&lt; ğ›¾ &lt;&lt; ":\n";
        draw_vbars&lt;4,3&gt;(bars);
        for (int n : indices)
            std::cout &lt;&lt; std::setw(2) &lt;&lt; n &lt;&lt; "  ";
        std::cout &lt;&lt; "\n\n";
    };

    cauchy(/* xâ‚€ = */ -2.0f, /* ğ›¾ = */ 0.50f);
    cauchy(/* xâ‚€ = */ +0.0f, /* ğ›¾ = */ 1.25f);
}
